dji.sdk.api

Class DJIDrone

  • java.lang.Object
    • dji.sdk.api.DJIDrone

  • public class DJIDrone
extends java.lang.Object

    DJIDrone Class

    As shown in the framework diagram, DJIDrone class, a brain of the drone, is an aggregation of all component classes of drone. Hence, DJIDrone could be used to invoke the specific functions, from the components, such as camera and gimbal, and to control the behavior of drone. In current version of the SDK, only one drone could be connected in an app.

    We recommend that developers should firstly connect to the Drone so that the rest of commands could be uploaded to the drone. Hence, an appropriate place for connection establishment is OnCreate() in MainActivity. Correspondingly, invoking disconnectToDrone() in OnDestory() of MainActivity is recommended.

    Now, you have already connect to the Drone. If you want to find out what amazing DJI products could provide to you, we would like to introduce you to look up the other classes (eg. camera and ground station).
    Version:
    V2.4.0
    Author:
    DJI Software

      • getDjiGroundStation

        public static DJIGroundStation getDjiGroundStation()
        Return a static object of DjiGroundStation. Ground Station provides some automatic operations for controlling the flight behavior of drone. However, all of the APIs in DjiGroundStation require that developers have the key of SDK-LEVEL-2. For Phantom 2 Vision/Phantom 2 Vision+, there are only joystick and ground station in the DJIGroundStation class. For Inspire 1 and Phantom 3, there are joystick, ground station, hot point and follow me(coming soon).
        Returns:
        DJIGroundStation

      • initWithType

        public static boolean initWithType(Context mContext,
                                   DJIDroneTypeDef.DJIDroneType type)
        Initialize the Drone with the type of Drone
        Parameters:
        mContext - The android application context
        type - DJIDrone_Vision,DJIDrone_Inspire1
        Returns:
        boolean true - successfully initialize drone
            false - initialize drone failed

      • connectToDrone

        public static boolean connectToDrone()
        Return the state of connection status between app and Drone. The value of true means that app successfully connects to the Drone. Otherwise, this operation has failed. Your app should start with this function so that the connections between app and components of drone could be set up.
        Returns:
        boolean true - the connection between app and drone has been successfully set up.
            false - this operation failed.

      • disconnectToDrone

        public static boolean disconnectToDrone()
        Return the status of disconnection status between app and Drone. The value of true means that the connection between app and Drone has been successfully disconnected. Otherwise, this operation is fail. Your app should end up with this function for ensuring that the connection is released.
        Returns:
        boolean true - the connection between app and drone has been successfully broken.
            false - this operation failed.

      • getLevel

        public static int getLevel()
        Return an integer which will be used to identify the permission for using SDK on a basis of the level key.
        Returns:
        int 1 - the SDK LEVEL is LEVEL 1.
          2 - the SDK LEVEL is LEVEL 2.

      • checkPermission

        public static void checkPermission(Context mContext,
                                   DJIGeneralListener mListener)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Check the sdk permission (visit forum.dji.com and select the mobile SDK to post the problem you faced or you can send emails to sdk@dji.com for directly contact)
        Parameters:
        mContext - The application context
        mListener - The check real result
              0 Check Permission Successful
              -1 Cannot connect to internet
              -2 Invalid App Key
              -3 Get permission data timeout
              -4 Device uuid not match
              -5 Project package name not match
              -6 App key forbidden
              -7 Active device num is up to the most allow num
              -8 App key platform error
              -9 APP key not exist
              -10 APP key no permission
              -11 Server parser failed
              -12 Server write uuid error
              -13 Server app package name abnormal
              -14 Server meta data parer failed
              -15 AES 256 encrypt unsupport
              -16 AES 256 encrypt failed
              -17 Get device uuid failed
              -18 Empty app key
              -1000 Server unkown error
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setDJIDroneTypeChangedCallback

        public static void setDJIDroneTypeChangedCallback(DJIDroneTypeChangedCallback mCallback)
        Support List: Inspire1, Phantom 3 Professional, Phantom 3 Advanced

        This function could be used to set up the program once the drone type has been changed. It would be important if the developers are developing a app for several drone types.

        Precondition : None

        Post Condition : If the interface instance has been set up, the sdk will executed the routine.

        Parameters:
        mCallback - - This interfacne instance will be executed once the drone type has been changed. For example, if a user switches the drone's connection from Inspire 1 to Phantom 3 Profession.
